Object.Field: LKM Oracle to Oracle Datapump Plus

COMPONENT NAME: LKM Oracle to Oracle Datapump Plus AUTHOR: Benjamin Perez-Goytia, Oracle A-Team WEBSITE: http://www.ateam-oracle.com/data-integration/di-odi/ COMPONENT VERSION: ODI 11.1.1.7.0 COMPATIBILITY: ODI 11.1.1.7.0
Use as reference the following blog for a detail description of this KM: http://www.ateam-oracle.com/using-oracle-data-pump-in-oracle-data-integrator-odi/
Description: - This is a customized version of the LKM datapump that comes out of the box in ODI 11g. - Loads data from an Oracle Server to an Oracle Server using external tables in the datapump format. - This module is recommended when developing interfaces between two Oracle servers. - An External table definition is created on the source and target servers. - Datapump files are being transfer using the Oracle file transfer utility (dbms_file_transfer.get_file). A dblink connection is required between source and target. The dblink connection should be defined in the target database. - The source schema must have the following database privileges in order to read Oracle directories:
- GRANT create any directory TO <source-schema>; - GRANT drop any directory TO <source-schema>;
- The target schema must have the following database privileges in order to read Oracle directories:
- GRANT create any directory TO <target-schema>; - GRANT drop any directory TO <target-schema>;
- Login as sys in the target database, and execute the following command if you plan to transfer the datapump files from source to target:
grant execute on dbms_file_transfer to <target-schema>
- Create the following public database link in the target database if you plan to transfer the datapump files from source to target:
CREATE PUBLIC DATABASE LINK "DB_LINK_NAME" CONNECT TO "<source schema name>" IDENTIFIED BY <password>' USING 'SOURCE_DB_NAME';
NOTE: Enter the DB_LINK_NAME in "Instance /dblink (Data Server):" of your Topology Source Data Server (the connection for your source database)
- This KM works for both non-journalized and journalized tables.
Restrictions:
Version History:
OCT-2013 - Initial creation of the KM by Benjamin Perez-Goytia, A-Team - Please visit the A-Team wesite at http://www.ateam-oracle.com/a-team-chronicles/
This option specifies the number of data pump files that will be created in parallel during the export operation.

This option specifies the number of parallel threads running at the same time to import data from the dump files. Note: Oracle recommends to have number of threads always greater than or equal to the number of dump files, so that multiple threads can read from the file and can write to the table at the same time.
This option specifies the location where the dump files created by the datapump export operation are stored. This can be a hard-coded value or an ODI variable.
This option specifies the location where the dump files dump files to be transferred after the datapump export operation is complete. This can be a hard-coded value or an ODI variable.

This feature is only available in versions of Oracle 11g and higher. When this option is "True", all data is compressed during the entire export operation. If the option is set to "False", then no data is compressed during the export operation.

Set this option to True if the files generated after the export datapump operation should be transferred to a different directory on the target server. Set the option to False if NFS mode is used to share a common directory between source and target servers, or if the target server has access to the exported datapump files located in the source server.

Set this option to True to delete the .DMP files generated during the import, file transfer and export operations Set the option to False to retain the .DMP files for debuggin purposes. Note: Recommended to set the value to Yes.

Set this option to True to delete the .LOG file generated during the export, file transfer and import operations. Set the option to False to retain the .LOG file for debuggin purposes. Note: Recommended to set the value to Yes..
Suffix Name for All Temp objects
Use this option to add a suffix to all temp objects created by this knowledge module. Oracle rules for naming objects should be followed. Alphanumeric characters are allowed as well as $ # _ .
Use this option to specify database hint to be used while exporting the data pump files. The hint will be used in the SELECT statement of the external table during the export operation.

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> update <%=odiRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> set JRN_CONSUMED = '1' where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>
Delete Data Files on the SOURCE
Delete Data Files on the TARGET

create table <%=odiRef.getTargetTable("TABLE_NAME")%><$="<%=odiRef.getOption("SUFFIX_NAME")%>"$>XS
( <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[CX_COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "")%> ) ORGANIZATION EXTERNAL ( TYPE oracle_datapump DEFAULT DIRECTORY <%=odiRef.getTargetTable("TABLE_NAME")%><$="<%=odiRef.getOption("SUFFIX_NAME")%>"$>S ACCESS PARAMETERS (<% if (odiRef.getOption( "COMPRESS_DATA" ).equals("1")) { out.print("COMPRESSION ENABLED"); } %> LOGFILE '<%=odiRef.getTargetTable("TABLE_NAME")%><$="<%=odiRef.getOption("SUFFIX_NAME")%>"$>.LOG') LOCATION ('<%=odiRef.getTargetTable("TABLE_NAME")%><$="<%=odiRef.getOption("SUFFIX_NAME")%>"$>1.DMP'<%for (int i=2; i<= (new Integer(odiRef.getOption( "NUM_OF_ACTIVE_WORKERS_EXPORT" )).intValue()) ; i++){%>,'<%=odiRef.getTargetTable("TABLE_NAME")%><$="<%=odiRef.getOption("SUFFIX_NAME")%>"$><%=+i%>.DMP'<%}%>) )
PARALLEL <%=odiRef.getOption("NUM_OF_ACTIVE_WORKERS_EXPORT")%>
as SELECT <$="<%=odiRef.getOption("OPTIMIZER_HINT")%>"$> <%=odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS")%> <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[EXPRESSION]", ",\n\t", "", "")%> from <%=odiRef.getFrom()%> where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getFilter()%> <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <%=odiRef.getJoin()%> <%=odiRef.getGrpBy()%> <%=odiRef.getHaving()%>

create table <%=odiRef.getTable( "COLL_NAME")%> ( <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[CX_COL_NAME]\t[DEST_WRI_DT]", ",\n\t", "","")%> ) ORGANIZATION EXTERNAL ( TYPE oracle_datapump DEFAULT DIRECTORY <%=odiRef.getTargetTable("TABLE_NAME")%><$="<%=odiRef.getOption("SUFFIX_NAME")%>"$>T ACCESS PARAMETERS (<% if (odiRef.getOption( "COMPRESS_DATA" ).equals("1")) { out.print("COMPRESSION ENABLED"); } %> LOGFILE '<%=odiRef.getTargetTable("TABLE_NAME")%><$="<%=odiRef.getOption("SUFFIX_NAME")%>"$>.LOG') LOCATION ('<%=odiRef.getTargetTable("TABLE_NAME")%><$="<%=odiRef.getOption("SUFFIX_NAME")%>"$>1.DMP'<%for (int i=2; i<= (new Integer(odiRef.getOption( "NUM_OF_ACTIVE_WORKERS_EXPORT" )).intValue()) ; i++){%>,'<%=odiRef.getTargetTable("TABLE_NAME")%><$="<%=odiRef.getOption("SUFFIX_NAME")%>"$><%=+i%>.DMP'<%}%>) ) PARALLEL <%=odiRef.getOption( "NUM_OF_ACTIVE_WORKERS_IMPORT" )%> REJECT LIMIT 0

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> delete from <%=odiRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> where JRN_CONSUMED = '1' <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>
Delete Data Files on the SOURCE
Delete Data Files on the TARGET
